heading: Voting age for European elections
subheading: Under current EU law, EU Member States are free to set their minimum national voting age for European elections. This age is set at 16 in Austria, Belgium, Germany and Malta, 17 in Greece, and 18 in the remaining Member States.
textNote: . In line with Article 8 of the European Elections Act, Member States can set the minimum voting age in their national legislation.
